reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:46:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I don't have a problem with this idea - if you don't need a custom nameserver, don't add it but the patch is incomplete.
Since we have a common case where we do use a custom nameserver, we need to think about where to define that - or use a diff if condition"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

to continue my comment - this would have to be attached to a patch that allows the reproducer script a -e nameserver option on the libvirt-nodepool playbook'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-02 17:39:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

ok - so now that I read the commit message more carefully, I'm -1 again on this patch. Before, when we used 'supersede' the problem of replacing the nameserver in the /etc/resolv.conf existed.
We replaced that with the 'append' option - which adds a nameserver and does not replace it. The original nameserver remains the first one - even when you restart unbound - see pasted results below:

 https://paste.fedoraproject.org/paste/Zz~2p2ur4rRScTesm9GDgA

Can you confirm that you are testing with the append option/latest code - and that you see different results?

Since we have a good number of users connecting via VPN, where this problem was detected, I am more inclined to keep the option as is."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-05-03 13:35:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Ronelle, again, we don't need to append anything in normal condition. If somebody has not working DNS he can use this workaround, but he has much bigger problem than not working reproducer.

You forget that we install unbound server in jobs, which changes resolv.conf, in my case it turns to be:

nameserver 127.0.0.1
nameserver 8.8.8.8

in our network 8.8.8.8 doesn't work, so I'm stuck with not working DNS at all!

Again - we do NOT need to interfere with peoples DNS in the host. If somebody want to override/add it - let him use this workaround, but it should NOT be a default case."}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-03 13:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I am removing my -1 - as I understand you are blocked and there is a workaround for those who nee another dns'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-05-03 16:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I would like to see (here other in a different patch, happy to post one) the following:

1. default of 8.8.8.8 since that's generally workable.  

2. make the input for custom_dns be of type "array" vs. "value".  For example for my machines, I need to add 3 additional DNS ideally...as lab things happen (packet load spikes, etc) so we need primary, secondary, ...)'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-05-03 19:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The whole reason we have the default of appending 8.8.8.8 is that we were having issues resolving the mirrorlist.centos.org urls without it. Here you change the default to do nothing, but provide no method to override said default in the reproducer script. So this fixes the issue you have while breaking everyone who came before.

I agree with Ronelle that this requires an ability to set the option in the reproducer script, if there is not a default that works for everyone.'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-05-03 19:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hmm...would it be a silly idea to (optionally) take the DNS settings from the virthost itself, and use *those*?  If they are correct for the virthost for a typical scenario (e.g. not wanting a dns server also in virt, or something elaborate) this would usually be correct yes?

For folks with lab machines, beaker (in my case...or other lab provisioner) for the virthost itself would likely be setting the dns settings as what makes sense for that lab.  

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-05-03 20:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546932/?'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-05-08 06:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-05-16 09:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Make custom nameserver optional

8.8.8.8 doesn't work in some networks and when unbound server
starts it replaces first nameserver to be 127.0.0.1, which ends up
with resolv.conf containing only 8.8.8.8.
make custom nameserver optional, because not working nameservers
is unusual situation.

Change-Id: Ia3ab6318e663bffa5f39900fdfedd5abe38c038c

commit_message:
Log a warning for Gen8 Inspection

This patch adds a warning for Prolaint Gen8 server's
NIC inspection. The proliantutils will start returning
only active NICs starting this patch
Ica624aae8f956a2da061801def6ddc43152a5b09.

story: #2004950
task: #29366

Depends-On: Ica624aae8f956a2da061801def6ddc43152a5b09
Change-Id: I71feefa3d0593fd185a286bec4ce38607203641d

commit_message:
Cleaning up logging

* Don't shadow LOG from outer scope.
* Always lazy-load logging.
* Fixed an invalid log line.

Change-Id: Ief40a3de554886c66f2063a0855b22ee1b5b758e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-24 15:18:42.000000000', 'message': "cinder-volume: Stop masking IOError different than ENOSPC

When glanceclient raises an IOError with a different errno than ENOSPC,
cinder-volume silently masked it and continued its volume creation
process. The result was volumes with invalid content being successfuly
created.

With the patch, an ImageDownloadFailed exception is raised in this case,
which makes the volume creation process fail and gives enough
information to operators for troubleshooting.

As explained in detail below, this patch is a squash of four cherry
picks to fix Bug #1799221.  The cherry-picks are being squashed
instead of done separately per normal cinder practice because they
are dependent; this will make sure that one of them isn't further
backported without the supporting patches.

Here's the relationship between the four cherry-picks:
(1) The purpose of this backport is to fix Bug #1799221, which was
    introduced in Pike.  It is fixed in Stein and Rocky by
    Ic011fe30b4840e5098db1a594ea276ec98768bff
(2) That change requires an exception introduced in Stein and backported
    to Rocky by If7c22ac4516f8c2a6ccd8bf6b6ed98409312b138 to fix Bug
    #1798147 (which defect is also present in Queens and Pike)
(3) The change in (2) introduced Bug #1808443 which was fixed in Stein
    and Rocky by I6d8dedfd056add3414f8f4bf7f7279eae4763286
(4) The change in (2) also introduced Bug #1811184, which is fixed by
    I6d8dedfd056add3414f8f4bf7f7279eae4763286 in Stein and Rocky, and
    which adds a unit test for Bug #1798147.
In short, in order to backport the fix for (1), we need to backport (2),
but in order to backport (2) we need to follow up immediately with
backports of (3) and (4) to fix the defects (2) introduces.

The attentive reader will note that this patch smuggles in the fix for
Bug #1798147.  We could have left this out, but it's a very small
isolated change, the defect is present in Queens and Pike (remember that
Bug #1799221, the subject of this patch, was introduced in Pike), and it
has a unit test (see (4), above).  Finally, leaving out the fix for
Bug #1798147 and backporting only the exception would still require
backporting the fixes for Bug #1808443 and Bug #1811184, so it really
would not simplify this patch.

To summarize what's being included here:
commit   changeId                                    fixed bug
805368e  If7c22ac4516f8c2a6ccd8bf6b6ed98409312b138   Bug #1798147
9c696ce  I2aa56da73660794c6dedcbb8a66e84bcec511a9c   Bug #1808443
844b627  I6d8dedfd056add3414f8f4bf7f7279eae4763286   Bug #1811184
bf89f76  Ic011fe30b4840e5098db1a594ea276ec98768bff   Bug #1799221

Change-Id: Ic011fe30b4840e5098db1a594ea276ec98768bff

commit_message:
cinder-volume: Stop masking IOError different than ENOSPC

When glanceclient raises an IOError with a different errno than ENOSPC,
cinder-volume silently masked it and continued its volume creation
process. The result was volumes with invalid content being successfuly
created.

With the patch, an ImageDownloadFailed exception is raised in this case,
which makes the volume creation process fail and gives enough
information to operators for troubleshooting.

As explained in detail below, this patch is a squash of four cherry
picks to fix Bug #1799221.  The cherry-picks are being squashed
instead of done separately per normal cinder practice because they
are dependent; this will make sure that one of them isn't further
backported without the supporting patches.

Here's the relationship between the four cherry-picks:
(1) The purpose of this backport is to fix Bug #1799221, which was
    introduced in Pike.  It is fixed in Stein and Rocky by
    Ic011fe30b4840e5098db1a594ea276ec98768bff
(2) That change requires an exception introduced in Stein and backported
    to Rocky by If7c22ac4516f8c2a6ccd8bf6b6ed98409312b138 to fix Bug
    #1798147 (which defect is also present in Queens and Pike)
(3) The change in (2) introduced Bug #1808443 which was fixed in Stein
    and Rocky by I6d8dedfd056add3414f8f4bf7f7279eae4763286
(4) The change in (2) also introduced Bug #1811184, which is fixed by
    I6d8dedfd056add3414f8f4bf7f7279eae4763286 in Stein and Rocky, and
    which adds a unit test for Bug #1798147.
In short, in order to backport the fix for (1), we need to backport (2),
but in order to backport (2) we need to follow up immediately with
backports of (3) and (4) to fix the defects (2) introduces.

The attentive reader will note that this patch smuggles in the fix for
Bug #1798147.  We could have left this out, but it's a very small
isolated change, the defect is present in Queens and Pike (remember that
Bug #1799221, the subject of this patch, was introduced in Pike), and it
has a unit test (see (4), above).  Finally, leaving out the fix for
Bug #1798147 and backporting only the exception would still require
backporting the fixes for Bug #1808443 and Bug #1811184, so it really
would not simplify this patch.

To summarize what's being included here:
commit   changeId                                    fixed bug

commit_message:
Fix secret-stores functional tests

This patch fixes some broken tests that were incorrectly
looking for a "secret-stores" key in API responses.  The
correct key is "secret_stores".

Change-Id: Ia42d14a1163f53d220e243ae0ecd5138e278db14

messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-07 15:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-10 01:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-14 17:54:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-01-14 18:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hardlinking when cloning between trees on the same filesystem is Git's normal behavior, so we needed to work around that. I agree world-writeable directories are a security concern in many contexts, though I'm not sure that concern applies to test frameworks like devstack-gate. I'll be the first to admit there were likely other solutions to this particular problem, but as we didn't intend for anyone to keep using the legacy autotranslated roles long-term it served as an expedient means of moving on to the variety of other migration issues we were having to tackle at the same time.

This is >1year later. I had honestly hoped (and I think so did many of us) that the "legacy" roles, along with zuul-cloner and devstack-gate, would be dead and buried by now. Most of the resistance to changing established behavior here is 1. we can't know for sure who it might break and 2. it legitimizes/encourages continued use of this deprecated and basically frozen toolchain.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-01-14 18:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note my comment is really more about Iaee3b2a515fada72f7d40eaae21dd1a08976f242 and the chmod there.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-02-08 18:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

life to short to fix devstack'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 15:34:26.000000000', 'message': 'Replace cp -l with --reflink=auto

Hardlinking in cp has special file permission requirements that can
make it fail.

Using --reflink=auto is much safer and does not have the same
requirements, while preserving its advantages.

This allows us to undo the unsecure chmod done on src dir .
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625576/

Change-Id: Ib42e08a2656ccbee780d15948a0390d9ab4ffc89
'}]
commit_message:
Replace cp -l with --reflink=auto

Hardlinking in cp has special file permission requirements that can
make it fail.

Using --reflink=auto is much safer and does not have the same
requirements, while preserving its advantages.

This allows us to undo the unsecure chmod done on src dir .
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625576/

Change-Id: Ib42e08a2656ccbee780d15948a0390d9ab4ffc89

commit_message:
stop using common db mixin methods

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin.

Change-Id: Ie766430b5f938df273f7b061d93c4325412d34ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-08 15:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Be more tolerant of success in test setup

I saw this failure in the gate:

	FAIL: test_crypto_max_length_path (test.unit.common.middleware.crypto.test_encryption.TestCryptoPipelineChanges)
	----------------------------------------------------------------------
	Traceback (most recent call last):
	  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/swift/test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_encryption.py", line 634, in test_crypto_max_length_path
	    container_path=self.container_path)
	  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/swift/test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_encryption.py", line 89, in _create_container
	    self.assertEqual('201 Created', resp.status)
	AssertionError: '201 Created' != '202 Accepted'

The logs showed one of the container nodes getting a request, which
201'd after 19s but the proxy logged it as a 10s timeout.  Then the
container logged a *second* PUT which 202'd.  I don't really understand
where the retry behavior is coming from.

Change-Id: Ia7e872220d8e69c87969187271b8ed9d103f93c1
'}]
commit_message:
Be more tolerant of success in test setup

I saw this failure in the gate:

	FAIL: test_crypto_max_length_path (test.unit.common.middleware.crypto.test_encryption.TestCryptoPipelineChanges)
	----------------------------------------------------------------------
	Traceback (most recent call last):
	  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/swift/test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_encryption.py", line 634, in test_crypto_max_length_path
	    container_path=self.container_path)
	  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/swift/test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_encryption.py", line 89, in _create_container
	    self.assertEqual('201 Created', resp.status)
	AssertionError: '201 Created' != '202 Accepted'

The logs showed one of the container nodes getting a request, which
201'd after 19s but the proxy logged it as a 10s timeout.  Then the
container logged a *second* PUT which 202'd.  I don't really understand
where the retry behavior is coming from.

Change-Id: Ia7e872220d8e69c87969187271b8ed9d103f93c1

subject: Stop using OpenDNS
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-02-08 17:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-02-08 17:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-08 17:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-08 17:34:50.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using OpenDNS

Ianw noticed problems on fedora29 with unbound. That resulted in a bug
filed upstream,
https://www.nlnetlabs.nl/bugs-script/show_bug.cgi?id=4226. In this bug
the helpful unbound maintainers point out that OpenDNS servers are
having trouble with RRSIG records which leads to not validating dnssec
which we require in our unbound config.

Address this by switching to CloudFlare DNS which is suppsoed to be
super localized (aka responsive), and not record queries against it.
Also if we want to we can update our config to do dns over tls against
these servers.

Change-Id: I08ef6a6fba2706803d2e9de6197e0ef8d695e313
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using OpenDNS

Ianw noticed problems on fedora29 with unbound. That resulted in a bug
filed upstream,
https://www.nlnetlabs.nl/bugs-script/show_bug.cgi?id=4226. In this bug
the helpful unbound maintainers point out that OpenDNS servers are
having trouble with RRSIG records which leads to not validating dnssec
which we require in our unbound config.

Address this by switching to CloudFlare DNS which is suppsoed to be
super localized (aka responsive), and not record queries against it.
Also if we want to we can update our config to do dns over tls against
these servers.

Change-Id: I08ef6a6fba2706803d2e9de6197e0ef8d695e313

'}, {'created': '2018-12-18 11:01:24.000000000', 'message': 'Improve speed of collect_logs.sh

- Adds --reflink=auto to cp
- Avoid storing uncompressed temp files
- Run gzip in parallel to optimize core usage
- Combine subunit files to a single one
- Makes collection logic easier to read and maintain
- Avoid misleading ignored errors on missing files as we expect to
miss some files on failed builds. If deployment failed, obviously that

commit_message:
Improve speed of collect_logs.sh

- Adds --reflink=auto to cp
- Avoid storing uncompressed temp files
- Run gzip in parallel to optimize core usage
- Combine subunit files to a single one
- Makes collection logic easier to read and maintain
- Avoid misleading ignored errors on missing files as we expect to
miss some files on failed builds. If deployment failed, obviously that
we would not have any tempest files to collect.

Change-Id: I7acce43694b76f65647eda6a4a69c5f3e60a41d5

commit_message:
Don't pull registry image from private registry

This avoids a potential circular dependency where the registry is the
source of its own image.

Also fixes up the image building documentation about the default value
of kolla_docker_registry.

Change-Id: Ia30173abf185329098ace621baf0ad1be75c0b74
Story: 2004820
Task: 29345

commit_message:
Use a fork of the yatesr.timezone role

The yatesr.timezone role has been forked to stackhpc.timezone, since the
upstream role includes symlinks which do not play nicely with PBR. Once
the PBR issue is fixed, we can revert to using the upstream role.

Change-Id: Ib8fe11cdf7e2571f99eb13c0e5ebd3e200c77c6e
Story: 2004252
Task: 27787

commit_message:
Sending TASK_FAILED event in case of MistralException

If task was failed by unhandled exceptions, Mistral was not sending
TASK_FAILED event, which could be critical for Mistral's clients, who
use notifications mechanism to handle issues.

Change-Id: I460686c2852e3eb642506049ad5c33705697ecd8
Closes-Bug: #1803746
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enable forwarding for all ipv4 interfaces

CentOS-7 is defaulting forwarding=0 which is preventing forwarding
from br-vlan bridge to the lxcbr0 bridge during tempest testing.

Change-Id: I9e2dcced64877e3b27709e4088c9c554092006cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 06:58:03.000000000', 'message': "Redfish inspect attempts local_gb via System extn

Redfish inspection will now first attempt to get the ``local_gb``
value from Sushy System extension discovered during the inspection
process. This is in addition to the existing logic of getting the
``local_gb`` value from Sushy system's ``SimpleStorage`` and
``Storage`` capabilities. Things introduced here are:

  * Include an optional property ``redfish_oem_property_name`` in
    the node's ``driver_info`` field for redfish driver.
  * Establishes a common API definition for ``get_local_gb()`` for
    the Redfish Sushy System OEM extension which provides the size
    of system attached local disk (or configured local volume) in
    GB.

Story: 2004878
Task: 29156
Depends-On: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de

commit_message:
Redfish inspect attempts local_gb via System extn

Redfish inspection will now first attempt to get the ``local_gb``
value from Sushy System extension discovered during the inspection
process. This is in addition to the existing logic of getting the
``local_gb`` value from Sushy system's ``SimpleStorage`` and
``Storage`` capabilities. Things introduced here are:

  * Include an optional property ``redfish_oem_property_name`` in
    the node's ``driver_info`` field for redfish driver.
  * Establishes a common API definition for ``get_local_gb()`` for
    the Redfish Sushy System OEM extension which provides the size
    of system attached local disk (or configured local volume) in
    GB.

Story: 2004878
Task: 29156
Depends-On: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de

Change-Id: I43787ad19ba1a5d7837d61d881dd3f4d394760b5

commit_message:
Improve error message when plugin detection fails.

The previous message didn't give much detail, which has led to
some confusion and questions from users. This change attempts to
add some more detail and help in debugging why a plugin detection
might fail.

Story: 2004696
Task: 28712

commit_message:
Ping router once it is created

Once router gets created. It is necessary to check from that router
we can ping public_network or not. It helps to debug what wents wrong
with in container. It should be only checked when router
admin_state_up is true

Change-Id: I24d1b93f88efe04dfab2b7790daa357a880e2c56

commit_message:
Remove python-notario package from mistral-executor image

This package was added to this image in change
Iccaace4ee84f46e01b9dfd62b9985f889d12ea37 for ceph-ansible, however it
won't be required once external deploy tasks are run via localhost
ssh.

Change-Id: I1038cdad4d1fda0f8d77799c15f55ca71d4f9ab8
Related-Bug: #1806065

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-08 14:16:21.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/losf

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I901e9c047aa18513fdd293c1f2a5415b0a37061e
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/losf

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I901e9c047aa18513fdd293c1f2a5415b0a37061e

[{'created': '2019-02-01 08:08:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest job

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627500 marks the integration
of os_tempest in tripleo ci, it is good to have a job here to make
sure that it does not break tripleo integration.

python_venv_build is used in os_tempest so adding tripleo os_tempest
(non-voting) jobs makes sure that it does not break the tripleo
os_tempest integration.

Change-Id: I4d45501844c3d8fe569927fd9ccab231ab093966
'}]
commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest job

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627500 marks the integration
of os_tempest in tripleo ci, it is good to have a job here to make
sure that it does not break tripleo integration.

python_venv_build is used in os_tempest so adding tripleo os_tempest
(non-voting) jobs makes sure that it does not break the tripleo
os_tempest integration.

Change-Id: I4d45501844c3d8fe569927fd9ccab231ab093966

tempest-full-py3 job configurations which we inherit for

commit_message:
Disable volume multiattach testing

Tempest change I522a15ba3dbfee5d8ef417e43288a12319abf6ff is
enabling volume multiattach testing in the tempest-full and
tempest-full-py3 job configurations which we inherit for
devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest and devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3
respectively. Since the rbd driver in cinder does not support
multiattach yet we need to disable multiattach testing for these
jobs.

Change-Id: Ia9bd6a42f33a7d9fe3041cf5c751ab691df19cb7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 21:41:41.000000000', 'message': 'Switch some Telemetry services to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change a few cycle-with-intermediary deliverables to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: I9c08bb4f25a0db57ac946ce6204a760f3491fb6e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch some Telemetry services to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change a few cycle-with-intermediary deliverables to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: I9c08bb4f25a0db57ac946ce6204a760f3491fb6e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 19:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Illustrate differences with new and legacy DB facade in unit tests

This is meant to illustrate the differences in behavior between the
new and legacy DB engine facades in subnet onboard. This uses the
legacy facade and there are no failures observed. This illustrates
how subnet pool prefixes are persisted differently. Here, at the
end of onboard_network_subnets(), the subnetpool is read from the DB
and the proper prefixes have been persisted. When using the new
facade onboard_network_subnets() must return before reading the
subnetpool will yield an updated prefix list.

It should be noted that in a real environment the behavior obseved
is that the prefix data does get persisted and can be read with
"openstack subnet pool show" after performing the onboard.

This is for illustration purposes only, do not merge.

Change-Id: Id70493045e0aef59e20274bafe98723c21488180

commit_message:
DNM: Illustrate differences with new and legacy DB facade in unit tests

This is meant to illustrate the differences in behavior between the
new and legacy DB engine facades in subnet onboard. This uses the
legacy facade and there are no failures observed. This illustrates
how subnet pool prefixes are persisted differently. Here, at the
end of onboard_network_subnets(), the subnetpool is read from the DB
and the proper prefixes have been persisted. When using the new
facade onboard_network_subnets() must return before reading the
subnetpool will yield an updated prefix list.

It should be noted that in a real environment the behavior obseved
is that the prefix data does get persisted and can be read with
"openstack subnet pool show" after performing the onboard.

This is for illustration purposes only, do not merge.

Change-Id: Id70493045e0aef59e20274bafe98723c21488180

subject: Use leader set for ceilometer-upgrade checks
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-02-07 20:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-02-07 21:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncharm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-08 15:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 20:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use leader set for ceilometer-upgrade checks

The previous attempt at addressing Bug#1811108 was a bit naive.
It was not HA aware and it failed to handle upgrade-charm.

This change moves from kv to leader-set as only the leader needs to run
the action and then inform the other nodes.

Note: on upgrade-charm we must assume the deployment has run
ceilometer-upgrade as there is no mechanism to determine this
independently. If we do not do this, the charm is in blocked state after
charm-upgrade. A warning is logged that this assumption has occurred.

Partial-Bug: #1811108
Change-Id: Idcc26df53542e78f0671942c99edfcbf61eccf6c
'}]
commit_message:
Use leader set for ceilometer-upgrade checks

The previous attempt at addressing Bug#1811108 was a bit naive.
It was not HA aware and it failed to handle upgrade-charm.

This change moves from kv to leader-set as only the leader needs to run
the action and then inform the other nodes.

Note: on upgrade-charm we must assume the deployment has run
ceilometer-upgrade as there is no mechanism to determine this
independently. If we do not do this, the charm is in blocked state after
charm-upgrade. A warning is logged that this assumption has occurred.

Partial-Bug: #1811108
Change-Id: Idcc26df53542e78f0671942c99edfcbf61eccf6c

rather than none, so globals.yml is generated with a syntax error:

                           ^ here

Change-Id: Ic36faaff37333f5af03a130dd97d31b26b7ff97f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix generation of globals.yml

kolla_inspector_* variables are identified by Jinja as empty strings
rather than none, so globals.yml is generated with a syntax error:

ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range: ,
                           ^ here

Change-Id: Ic36faaff37333f5af03a130dd97d31b26b7ff97f

commit_message:
mysql: use clustercheck credentials to poll galera state

In the galera container, clustercheck is currently configured to
use root credentials to poll the state of the local galera node.

configure clustercheck to use the clustercheck credentials instead.

Change-Id: Icca33ec759a9ef5abca6da4cd2e59f0a5d9b7061
Related-Bug: #1792416

I'd be okay to vote positively when WIP is removed and it passes linters."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-22 12:41:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> Wasn't there a need for a migration shell script?

The scripts provided by placement are at https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/placement/tree/tools

These are for the situation where you want to upgrade from placement-in-nova to placement-by-itself. The automate the management of copy the placement from nova's db to the placement db. They can be used either as is, or as a guide for something else that makes sense for the environment they'll be used in."}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2018-11-22 12:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-22 12:50:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

 > management of copy the placement from nova's db to the placement

commit_message:
Add initial placement role

This patch adds the support for the placement service with
a simple functional test which hits the API (which in turn
hits the database and keystone for authorization).

Depends-On: I878e8c479d8963b339b5e1f6031f649c0f87082f
Change-Id: Iaa11a8cc4d945712b62c3b9c2cb6ad168def34eb

commit_message:
Deprecate CoreOS ramdisk support

Deprecates ironic's CoreOS IPA image ramdisks and removes the
bulk of CoreOS based CI testing in order to save resources.

Change-Id: I26c557dcb2be29ae41576527c2649ee7ff43bc87

commit_message:
Only run the needed services for CephFS jobs

These jobs often fail due to timeouts so only enable the services
required for devstack tests with these back ends.

Change-Id: Ib620ec3c2a9999ea9908a7c23aa7172c40a4cbd9
(cherry picked from commit f096d1145c7b14fae2c666b8d088574e570bffd4)
(cherry picked from commit a950ce0da5cc0e0757a82d921ca38be557c0bbfc)

subject: Make sure we get my.cnf installed on upgrade re-provisionning.
messages:
[{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-01-24 13:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-01-24 14:04:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2019-01-24 15:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-24 16:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thx Sofer,

There's indeed a problem with the current logic: if for any reason the file wasn't present on the host (be it due to a re-provisioning or due to an earlier failure - like https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1809145)

The original intent of the code was "do not overwrite an existing password file", so I guess a better fix would be to not use the specific mysql hiera key, and instead store implement something like "if we are in an UPDATE and there was no pre-existing password file, create it, otherwise do not overwrite it"

I'll try to come up with a review tomorrow'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2019-01-24 16:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-29 16:30:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've finally pushed a proposed fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633768/, because it fixes a reported launchpad bug and it should fix your issue as well.

If you can give it a try that would be awesome"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-02-08 13:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

In favor of  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633768/,'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-24 13:55:50.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we get my.cnf installed on upgrade re-provisionning.

During upgrade we are reprovisioning the pacemaker cluster so we are
in heat state UPDATE but the node is empty (no password to keep).  So
we need to make sure that my.cnf is correctly installed.

We add a check that looks for a specific hiera variable that is
present only during reprovisioning.

Change-Id: Icb66ce49a14c85a5aec680a73acb6ca761d26ec1
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os
'}, {'created': '2019-01-24 14:04:32.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we get my.cnf installed on upgrade re-provisionning.

During upgrade we are reprovisioning the pacemaker cluster so we are
in heat state UPDATE but the node is empty (no password to keep).  So
we need to make sure that my.cnf is correctly installed.

We add a check that looks for a specific hiera variable that is
present only during reprovisioning.

Change-Id: Icb66ce49a14c85a5aec680a73acb6ca761d26ec1
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we get my.cnf installed on upgrade re-provisionning.

During upgrade we are reprovisioning the pacemaker cluster so we are
in heat state UPDATE but the node is empty (no password to keep).  So
we need to make sure that my.cnf is correctly installed.

We add a check that looks for a specific hiera variable that is
present only during reprovisioning.

Change-Id: Icb66ce49a14c85a5aec680a73acb6ca761d26ec1
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
run docker_puppet_tasks on any role

Currently this assumes all tasks will run on the primary controller
but because of composable roles, that may not be the case.

An example is if you deploy keystone on any role other than the
role tagged primary e.g Controller by default, we don't create
any of the users/endpoints because the tasks aren't written to
the role unless keystone actually runs there.

Closes-Bug: #1792613
Change-Id: Ib6efd03584c95ed4ab997f614aa3178b01877b8c

[{'created': '2019-02-07 19:28:14.000000000', 'message': "Add HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait

Add a trait reflecting a compute host's capability to offer AMD's
on-chip Secure Encrypted Virtualization functionality:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zen_(microarchitecture)#Enhanced_security_and_virtualization_support
https://developer.amd.com/sev/

This will facilitate booting of security-sensitive VMs only on hosts
which offer additional security via SEV.  More details available here:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html

Change-Id: I8ebfeac3cabbb64a7913f0b8193010a1b712382b

commit_message:
Add HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait

Add a trait reflecting a compute host's capability to offer AMD's
on-chip Secure Encrypted Virtualization functionality:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zen_(microarchitecture)#Enhanced_security_and_virtualization_support
https://developer.amd.com/sev/

This will facilitate booting of security-sensitive VMs only on hosts
which offer additional security via SEV.  More details available here:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html

Change-Id: I8ebfeac3cabbb64a7913f0b8193010a1b712382b
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-02-07 06:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

[{'created': '2019-02-07 03:39:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing a failure of creating a snapshot in Consistency Group

Commit f85e0ffa9135a60ff203651ce7bfd5c0ca36ceec moved Consistency Group out of Volumes panel.
During this work, project/cgroups/templates/cgroups/_create_snapshot.html was not changed.
It caused that user cannot create a snapshot in Consistency Group via Horizon.
This patch fixes the location of the template and it prevents the traceback below.

~~~

    response = self.process_exception_by_middleware(e, request)

    response = response.render()
...<snip>...
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/template/loader_tags.py", line 204, in render
    template = context.template.engine.get_template(template_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/template/engine.py", line 162, in get_template
    template, origin = self.find_template(template_name)

    raise TemplateDoesNotExist(name, tried=tried)
TemplateDoesNotExist: project/volumes/cgroups/_snapshot_limits.html
~~~

Change-Id: Ic8a569cf0781e816e6da6f4423c5cd3bcc9e2eb7

commit_message:
Fixing a link in templates of CG and CG snapshots

Commit f85e0ffa9135a60ff203651ce7bfd5c0ca36ceec moved Consistency Group
out of Volumes panel.
During the work, some template files were not modified with new location.
A lack of the modification caused that user cannot create a snapshot in
Consistency Group via Horizon.
This patch fixes the location of the template and it prevents the
traceback.

Change-Id: Ic8a569cf0781e816e6da6f4423c5cd3bcc9e2eb7
Closes-Bug: #1815165

commit_message:
Fix osprofiler support in horizon

This patch is fixing usage of osprofiler in horizon.
It has been merged once, but after merge to master,
manage.py compress starts to fail with python2.7.

This fail was caused by "TypeError: 'encoding' is an
invalid keyword argument for this function" which is
now fixed by using six library.

Change-Id: I21aa8d49833bef9e7673958d15674faec82a0925
Closes-Bug: #1814028
Related-Bug: #1811261

commit_message:
Use monasca-log-api.conf for doc, devstack and docker

api-log.conf is the deprecated path for the configuration file. The
new path is /etc/monasca/monasca-log-api.conf .
So use this new path in devstack, documentation and docker.

Change-Id: I2208b7e27d3dbec38290ffb8ba66bc64a5129744
Story: 2004831
Task: 29024

[{'created': '2019-01-29 15:17:22.000000000', 'message': 'Define OSA clone dir in the openstack-ansible.sh script

When the openstack-ansible.sh was extracted from bootstrap.sh,
the resolving from the OSA_CLONE_DIR was broken.

Due to this, the OSA_CLONE_DIR value is empty, and the comparison
in the openstack-ansible is always true, which is not what we
want for external use.

Change-Id: I6a05d3b73838fa646a635831d655f7470df3378f
'}]
commit_message:
Define OSA clone dir in the openstack-ansible.sh script

When the openstack-ansible.sh was extracted from bootstrap.sh,
the resolving from the OSA_CLONE_DIR was broken.

Due to this, the OSA_CLONE_DIR value is empty, and the comparison
in the openstack-ansible is always true, which is not what we
want for external use.

Change-Id: I6a05d3b73838fa646a635831d655f7470df3378f

subject: Add an ip address to eth12 in OSA test containers
messages:
[{'account_id': 28665, 'date': '2019-02-07 21:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-02-07 22:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I created the fix for os_tempest which this patch is based on - in order to unwedge the tempest gate and allow the osa/tripleo collaboration to progress. The approach used does indeed work but it crosses the external provider network into the interior of all of the containers which is highly unrealistic.

Even worse, I'm unable to reproduce the failure seen in the os_nova gate in a local centos vm, see http://paste.openstack.org/show/744713/.

I think this really warrants getting infra to hold a test node for an os_nova patch and debug the underlying issue further."}, {'account_id': 28665, 'date': '2019-02-08 02:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah ok.  I misunderstood this morning and thought this was the direction being suggested to go.  I have continued to troubleshoot the issue throughout the day before I finally gave in and pushed this up.  You can reproduce it by using the distro_install gate without having to install the missing dependencies.

I have isolated the problem to the br-vlan bridge to lxcbr0 bridge communication.  When you ping the floating ip from the infra1 container the request reaches the VM and a reply is sent.  I can see the reply leaving the br-vlan bridge and never arriving at the lxcbr0 bridge.

This is driving me crazy.  I feel like I have run into this exact problem in the past and cannot remember what the fix was.  Usually its something like a missing route or blocking iptables rule, but all the configuration looks good as far as I can tell.  I know I am going to be kicking myself once the solution is discovered.'}, {'account_id': 28665, 'date': '2019-02-08 12:00:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ok I finally solved it.  Despite having set ip_forward=1 each interface carries a forwarding variable that for br-vlan is set to 0 which is preventing forwarding.  By simply setting sysctl -w net.ipv4.conf.br-vlan.forwarding=1 traffic is able to flow from br-vlan back to the lxcbr0 network.   I'll update this patch with the fix."}, {'account_id': 28665, 'date': '2019-02-08 12:03:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Come to think of it this change doesn't belong in the os_nova repo. Abandoning this change and will create a new one in the appropriate place."}, {'account_id': 28665, 'date': '2019-02-08 12:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 21:38:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add an ip address to eth12 in OSA test containers

The tempest tests need to ssh to booted virtual machines. The neutron
public network is 10.1.3.0/24, which is the flat network on br-vlan.
From the container perspective this was previously reached via the
default gateway on eth0 as there was no specific route to the
10.1.3.0/24 network.

On centos traffic is no longer being forwarded to the br-vlan flat network
via the container eth0 and host networking, but this still works for
other distributions.

This patch adds an IP address to the present, but previously un-addressed
interface eth12 in each container. This gives a direct route to the neutron
public network from the container and does not require the host network
to forward the traffic. The test setup is now more decoupled from the
host networking which should increase reliability.

Change-Id: I3e2cb826a8deca4a8cd0f0d584d252494e32e509
'}]
commit_message:
Add an ip address to eth12 in OSA test containers

The tempest tests need to ssh to booted virtual machines. The neutron
public network is 10.1.3.0/24, which is the flat network on br-vlan.
From the container perspective this was previously reached via the
default gateway on eth0 as there was no specific route to the
10.1.3.0/24 network.

On centos traffic is no longer being forwarded to the br-vlan flat network
via the container eth0 and host networking, but this still works for
other distributions.

This patch adds an IP address to the present, but previously un-addressed
interface eth12 in each container. This gives a direct route to the neutron
public network from the container and does not require the host network
to forward the traffic. The test setup is now more decoupled from the
host networking which should increase reliability.

Change-Id: I3e2cb826a8deca4a8cd0f0d584d252494e32e509

commit_message:
Remove docker/podman from mistral-executor

These are not required to be inside the image once external deploy
tasks are run via localhost ssh.

libseccomp is also removed as it was only required for podman.

Change-Id: I90c70fda0625d62d0c4a84f719a5955284798528

commit_message:
Use ssh in generated inventory for undercloud

This switches over to ssh for external deploy tasks, so they are run
in the context of the undercloud host instead of inside the
mistral-executor container.

Change-Id: Iae415339308a93ad49eeb7e4d7e0be2662abf0ee

commit_message:
Authorize undercloud tripleo-admin user

This adds the public key into the .ssh/authorized_keys file
in /home/tripleo-admin. Failure is ignored because this may be running
on an undercloud which doesn't yet have a configured tripleo-admin
user.

This change also refactors the removal of the generate_playbook task
since the playbook now just invokes a role, there is no maintainence
benefit to justify the extra complexity.

Partial-Bug: #1813832
Change-Id: Id2ee912c456d66ed189fd5fdbaa5c1c3627bdf20
Depends-On: I4c8ee04534636622581eb386c01790d6610e7f58

commit_message:
ovn-metadata-agent: bind haproxy to 169.254.169.254

Currently ovn-metadata-agent spawns haproxy to bind in 0.0.0.0 inside
the ovnmeta namespace. This is not needed as we know that we'll always
receive those in 169.254.169.254 and it can have security issues.

Closes-Bug: #1745618
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I19ba651ad5b120ecb9859d9f7786b447f3218078

commit_message:
Remove the use of tests as filters as it will be deprecated.

As of Ansible 2.5, using an Ansible provided jinja test with filter syntax,
will display a deprecation error, they should be switched into using 'is' [0].

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/porting_guides/porting_guide_2.5.html#id17

Change-Id: I46912d6cff8b8332bbe875166636523f02a8088b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 14:23:46.000000000', 'message': "Do not pull image while tagging pcmk images in upgrade_tasks.

During the upgrad of pacemaker managed services there is
a temporary tagging of the existing container image to the
newly image we are going to upgrade to. The input during this
taggins is the container image id, in contrast to what is
passed during deploy tasks, which is the image name with its
tag. For that reason, we can't pull the image in these cases
otherwise the role will fail as it can't find an image to pull
from a container image id.

Change-Id: I4fdd3a05465fa0318b4ec5c079d59f4dd80fa9f2
Depends-On: I6fc69f122b3f48064ed831cd622a617a02a28e02
Closes-Bug: #1814104

commit_message:
Do not pull image while tagging pcmk images in upgrade_tasks.

During the upgrad of pacemaker managed services there is
a temporary tagging of the existing container image to the
newly image we are going to upgrade to. The input during this
taggins is the container image id, in contrast to what is
passed during deploy tasks, which is the image name with its
tag. For that reason, we can't pull the image in these cases
otherwise the role will fail as it can't find an image to pull
from a container image id.

Change-Id: I4fdd3a05465fa0318b4ec5c079d59f4dd80fa9f2
Closes-Bug: #1814104

[{'created': '2019-02-04 22:03:10.000000000', 'message': "Cap virtualenv version to 16.2.0 or earlier

Virtualenv version >16.2.0 uses 'pip config list' command to
read the pip configuration. However devstack caps pip version
to <10 and it doesn't have this command. so we have to cap
virtualenv to fix the breakage.

Closes-Bug: #1813860
Change-Id: I2084c5577b1ee1b4cdc7e1698786df99e3e512ec
"}]
commit_message:
Cap virtualenv version to 16.2.0 or earlier

Virtualenv version >16.2.0 uses 'pip config list' command to
read the pip configuration. However devstack caps pip version
to <10 and it doesn't have this command. so we have to cap
virtualenv to fix the breakage.

Closes-Bug: #1813860
Change-Id: I2084c5577b1ee1b4cdc7e1698786df99e3e512ec

commit_message:
Delete loadbalancers and floatingips for service and ingress

This patch makes the regex more broad to cover both services and ingresses that
create load balancers in octavia. In cloud-provider-openstack repo, the load
balancer description is defined in:

- https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/f056677572b2635632abcc7dbde459cdfc4432b9/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/openstack/openstack_loadbalancer.go#L459
- https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/f056677572b2635632abcc7dbde459cdfc4432b9/pkg/ingress/controller/openstack/octavia.go#L316

The floating ip description is defined in:

- https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/f056677572b2635632abcc7dbde459cdfc4432b9/pkg/cloudprovider/providers/openstack/openstack_loadbalancer.go#L1063
- https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/f056677572b2635632abcc7dbde459cdfc4432b9/pkg/ingress/controller/openstack/neutron.go#L72

Change-Id: I7ce38e38de0d66fac340e287ce520de4c4bf679d
Story: 2004839
(cherry picked from commit d2f36a2ed171f6be2c57d98a038edf1e97cc88a5)

commit_message:
remove pep8 from lower-constraints.txt

Older hacking version depends on pep8, but pep8 module is replaced
by pycodestyle. This is already resolved by updating hacking
version in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627148/

pep8 is dropped, so no longer require in lower-constraints.txt.

Change-Id: I4c834e11515c9384975801e1b710fa554c726c0d

commit_message:
WIP DNM Set a variable to determine if we are inside a minor update workflow

With this we can optimize away the restart bundles if we are going to
stop the cluster anyway.

commit_message:
bump ansible from 2.5 to 2.6

Adopts newer version of ansible before 2.5 branch is deprecated.
This change should be merged only when we are confident that our
code works correctly with the newer version. Implement preparatory
changes outside of this commit, if possible.

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/v2.6.11/changelogs/CHANGELOG-v2.6.rst

Notable fixes:
- blockinfile
- lineinfile
- docker modules
- loop

Change-Id: Ib8391a1cf709878c5b06b66a43e81ae1e1220261
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/386

commit_message:
Option "scheduler_default_filters" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated.

Use option "enabled_filters" from group "filter_scheduler".

Change-Id: I042f0b011c060f9dbc645dbdbb60068cb41c0cc8

subject: Enable mistral to see the changes at overcloud_containers.yaml.j2
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 15:02:42.000000000', 'message': 'Enable mistral to see the changes at overcloud_containers.yaml.j2

As a developer, we might need to add some kolla images, updating
the /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common-containers directory on
the host does not affect the folder on the container.

Mounting the directories as "ro" on the containers, makes the changes
on the host visible by mistral containers.

Change-Id: I58369124f9a44f75334e71c131b5211471a2fd12
'}]
commit_message:
Enable mistral to see the changes at overcloud_containers.yaml.j2

As a developer, we might need to add some kolla images, updating
the /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common-containers directory on
the host does not affect the folder on the container.

Mounting the directories as "ro" on the containers, makes the changes
on the host visible by mistral containers.

Change-Id: I58369124f9a44f75334e71c131b5211471a2fd12

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-24 07:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kaifeng, Ilya: Thanks for your comments and feedback, I hear your concerns (and share some of them actually :)

What I'd like to achieve eventually is that after a deployment the BIOS boot order is the same as before the deployment, so Ironic should not make any persistent changes (as mentioned in the story, this is required by policy in our DC).

How about:
- renaming the option to "preserve_bios_boot_order" which, when enabled, does always use persistent=false when doing IPMI boot calls (along the lines of what Ilya proposed),
- moving that option to [deploy] as it has a wider range (as pointed out by Kaifeng)

Would that make things clearer? 

(I'll submit a patch set with a link to the story.)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-24 07:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-01-24 07:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> renaming the option to "preserve_bios_boot_order" which, when enabled, does always use persistent=false when doing IPMI boot calls (along the lines of what Ilya proposed),


Should it apply to IPMI only? I think with the current patch it works across all hardware types, no?'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-24 08:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Thanks, Kaifeng!'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-24 08:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Thanks, Ilya!'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-24 08:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Should it apply to IPMI only? I think with the current patch it works across all hardware types, no?

If we go for a "preserve_original_bios_boot_order" patch, it should apply to all hardware types which touch that, I agree.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-24 09:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-01-24 09:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The question is whether this should be a) an option limited to the IPMI h/w type or b) if this option should be applied to all types (and their boot interfaces).

a) would satisfy the concrete use case at hand (but add an IPMI only option);
b) would be more clean/consistent (but unclear if needed)

This may need some more input from the community.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2019-01-24 14:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

- dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipmi https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/74/632774/4/check/dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipmi/b065dc6/ : SUCCESS in 44m 47s
- dell-hw14G-UEFI-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipmi https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/74/632774/4/check/dell-hw14G-UEFI-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipmi/610035d/ : SUCCESS in 45m 26s'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-01-29 09:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thank you. There is a driver_info property 'force_persistent_boot_device' that gets used in PXE/iPXE boot interfaces which has similar behavior to what being proposed. The only difference I can see is that the proposed property would be used during instance boot whereas 'force_persistent_boot_device' gets used during cleaning/deployment operation. Will it be possible to use the same property and enhance it to be a configuration parameter to control the overall persistence of the boot device order?"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-29 17:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for reviewing, Shivanand!

If I am not mistaken, 'force_persistent_boot_device' serves a slightly different purpose, namely to make all "short-term" boot order changes persistent in order to improve performance. Turning that into an option to control the persistency of the last boot order change would prevent a user who wants a non-persistent boot device to profit from this performance improvement. As this would in addition also change the current behaviour when using this option (even if it is only exposed as a property), I'd think it's better to keep these two aims separate.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-29 20:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Giving this some more thought:

1. Ironic's default is to make non-persistent changes to the boot order (and this patch proposes to extend this to prepare_instance() as well).

However:

If "force_persistent_boot_device" is set on a node, all changes are persistent; in this case the new option (if set to preserve_bios_boot_order=True) would make the last call in prepare_instance() non-persistent (which is not what was intended when "force_persistent_boot_device" was) set; so: the proposed option needs to respect "force_persistent_boot_device" (as a higher priority per node setting). It would anyway not be able to preserve the boot order in this case.

2. An IRC suggestion was to check whether this option move up from the h/w types (rather than being added to each h/w type). I promised to have a look, but I don't see how this could be done in a way that is clear and easy to understand later on (and does not interfere with other options such as "ipmi_force_boot_device" or "force_persistent_boot_device").

I'll submit a new patch set with these two points in mind.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2019-01-30 23:34:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build failed.

Shivanand, thanks for bearing with me here :-)

True, 'force_persistent_boot_device' is only for clean/deploy. However: upon instance boot, the boot device was persistent by default. So, by setting this option all boot changes were made persistent and I was thinking this is probably what you want when you use this option, no? But you're totally right: strictly speaking the option never promised it'd apply to instance boot.

As for your suggestion to merge these options: I agree that things get a little complicated from a configuration point of view. I'll have a look into merging these  two options into one. (BTW, option 4. should read: "persistent=True during provisioning and persistent=False for instance boot, this is when you'd like the performance improvements boot no persistent boot).

Thanks, again for your thoughts!'}, {'account_id': 25547, 'date': '2019-01-31 08:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

lxca recheck'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-01 07:53:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Shivanand, about merging the options: how about changing 'force_persistent_boot_device' to allow three values:
1. 'force_persistent_boot_device'='Default': non-persistent on clean/deploy, but persistent on the last for instance creation (the current default behaviour)
2. 'force_persistent_boot_device'='Always': always make persistent changes (the current 'force_persistent_boot_device'=True)
3. 'force_persistent_boot_device'='Never': never do any persistent changes (new)

I think this might be much clearer from a config point of view. I'd also cover the old values (True/False for cases 1. and 2.), so that the settings are backwards compatible. It'd be a (i)PXE-only option, but I think that is fine."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-01 09:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thank you Arne. Your proposal looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-01 14:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2019-02-01 14:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

Greetings Arne!

I'm all for the idea, I just think we need to be careful because this patch effectively changes how a dictionary field is interpreted which allows a user to store an explicit boolean value or a string value such as 'true' or 'false', or even 0, or 1... all of which is converted by bool_from_string. I think it might be okay if we expand the set of what we check, since I think that is ultimately what bool_from_string does as well."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-07 07:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review

@Julia: the thought of various ways bool_from_string() interprets True/False, but I thought user would refer to the documentation of this driver_info parameter [1] and set accordingly. But I agree, better to take care of behavior of bool_from_string().

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_base.py#L33-L37'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 09:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Thanks, Julia. 

I guess the question is whether we want to carry forward such "sloppy" configurations :)
How about we extend what we currently allow, i.e as you suggest I add "true", "TRUE", "false", "0" ... to the patch, but we also add a warning saying that only the new values ("Default", "Always, "Never") will be allowed in a future release?'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 09:34:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Shivanand, any thoughts on my suggestion?'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-07 10:30:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I think we can first check if the value being passed is a new value ('Default', 'Always', 'Never') and interpret accordingly. Otherwise call bool_from_string() which would always default to 'False' for anything that is not True ('t','true', 'on', 'y', 'yes', or '1'; see [1]) and provide the older behavior.

persistent = False
value = driver_info.get('force_persistent_boot_device', False))
if value in {'Always', 'Never', 'Default'}:
    persistent = compute persistent according to value
else:
    persistent = strutils.bool_from_string(driver_info.get('force_persistent_boot_device',
                                 False))

manager_utils.node_set_boot_device(..., persistent=persistent)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/master/oslo_utils/strutils.py#L117-L122"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 10:33:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thanks, Shivanand. What about removing support for the old values?'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 11:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 12:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

Thanks Julia & Shivanand.

I changed the patch to be fully backwards compatible.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 12:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Thanks, Julia.
 > 
 > I guess the question is whether we want to carry forward such
 > "sloppy" configurations :)
 > How about we extend what we currently allow, i.e as you suggest I
 > add "true", "TRUE", "false", "0" ... to the patch, but we also add
 > a warning saying that only the new values ("Default", "Always,
 > "Never") will be allowed in a future release?
The conundrum is these are fields that are often forgotten about. We could add a post-upgrade check and have operators go change any entries that are incompatible, but a lot of the driver_info fields have becomes set and forget kind of fields for most deployments, especially those with smaller fleets.  I kind of feel like we're likely going to have to keep compatibility forever. Then again we could deprecate and provide an elongated path forward with an upgrade check.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-07 18:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

"}, {'created': '2019-01-30 16:23:29.000000000', 'message': "Optionally preserve BIOS boot order upon instance deployment

By default, Ironic makes persistent changes to the BIOS boot order
at the end of an instance deployment. This may not be desired in
all cases, e.g. when DC policies require to leave the persistent
BIOS boot order unchanged.
While keeping the persistent approach as the default, this patch
proposes a 'preserve_bios_boot_order' option which allows to make
these final changes before booting the instance non-persistent
(with the PXE/iPXE boot interfaces).
If a node's driver_info has 'force_persistent_boot_order' set to
make all boot order changes persistent for performance reasons,
the proposed option takes lower priority and will be ignored.

Change-Id: If3a19f74fb0dfbcff2cde4cd5a8cc1edf5de3058
Story: #2004846
Task: #29058

at the end of an instance deployment. This may not be desired in
all cases, e.g. when DC policies require to leave the persistent
BIOS boot order unchanged.
While keeping the persistent approach as the default, this patch
proposes to extent the existing 'force_persistent_boot_device'
field in the node's driver_info for (i)PXE in a way that allows
to have all boot device changes to be non-persistent.

commit_message:
Optionally preserve original system boot order upon instance deployment

By default, Ironic makes persistent changes to the system boot order
at the end of an instance deployment. This may not be desired in
all cases, e.g. when DC policies require to leave the persistent
system boot order unchanged.
While keeping the persistent approach as the default, this patch
proposes to extent the existing 'force_persistent_boot_device'
field in the node's driver_info for (i)PXE in a way that allows
to have all boot device changes to be non-persistent.

Change-Id: If3a19f74fb0dfbcff2cde4cd5a8cc1edf5de3058
Story: #2004846
Task: #29058

commit_message:
Install multipath dependencies when use-multipath is True

This change ensures that the multipath dependencies are installed
on the compute node when the use-multipath config flag is enabled.

Change-Id: I39b017398b95f5901d9bc57ffa0c59ff59f3a359
Closes-Bug: #1806830
(cherry picked from commit a445a33add78f9a295b2f49ca1440ad4c1c9a4fe)

commit_message:
WIP-Approach A:Ceph-Journal-Automation

- Continue to use /dev/sdc1 format for desired journal
partition and appropriate partition will be created.
- this PS uses sgdisk --new=3:0:+10240M /dev/sdc1
command which, in this example, creates 3rd partition

commit_message:
Horizon: Expose additional security config params

Expose additional Horizon security params in accordance with the
OpenStack Security Guide [0]

- Check-Dashboard-03: Is DISALLOW_IFRAME_EMBED parameter set to True
- Check-Dashboard-07: Is PASSWORD_AUTOCOMPLETE set to False

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/dashboard/checklist.html

Change-Id: I355ddbc9fb1dcd0a6100ee650afd54680ef9ffbd

[{'created': '2019-01-31 23:03:39.000000000', 'message': "init command line config options once

Previously, it was observed that two separate inits were needed,
one near the beginning of congress_server.py and the other
at the beginning of congress_server.py:main().
It seems no longer necessary to do it at two separate places.

Here we do the initialization in bin/congress-server because it's
the first place that sees the command line options.

Change-Id: I7fbc12195f5d79d7df8da3bb835f3f89c1244efc
"}, {'created': '2019-02-01 01:24:01.000000000', 'message': "move config init from congress_servers.py to bin/congress-server

The need to execute config init before importing harness in
congress_servers.py causes a style violation in hacking 1.1.0.

Here we move the initialization in bin/congress-server because it's
the first place that sees the command line options.

It also allows the work on upping hacking to 1.1.0 to go ahead.

Change-Id: I7fbc12195f5d79d7df8da3bb835f3f89c1244efc
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 01:36:44.000000000', 'message': "move config init from congress_servers.py to bin/congress-server

The need to execute config init before importing harness in
congress_servers.py causes a style violation in hacking 1.1.0.

Here we move the initialization in bin/congress-server because it's
the first place that sees the command line options.

It also allows the work on upping hacking to 1.1.0 to go ahead.

Change-Id: I7fbc12195f5d79d7df8da3bb835f3f89c1244efc
"}]
commit_message:
move config init from congress_servers.py to bin/congress-server

The need to execute config init before importing harness in
congress_servers.py causes a style violation in hacking 1.1.0.

Here we move the initialization in bin/congress-server because it's
the first place that sees the command line options.

It also allows the work on upping hacking to 1.1.0 to go ahead.

Change-Id: I7fbc12195f5d79d7df8da3bb835f3f89c1244efc

commit_message:
Default embedded instance.flavor.is_public attribute

It is possible that really old instances don't actually have this
attribute defined which can lead to raising exceptions when loading
their embedded flavors from the database.

This patch fixes this by defaulting these values to true if they
are not set.

Change-Id: If04cd802ce7184dc94f94804c743faebe0d4bd8c
Closes-Bug: #1789423
(cherry picked from commit c4f6b0bf6cc903cf52c4b238c3771604dda174b8)
(cherry picked from commit c689c09996c4a3da9e05ccd5178a4b5060949889)
(cherry picked from commit 61bf7ae5795a3dfac7afc57bed9b4195cfdb6042)
(cherry picked from commit 9a0d338c6775803516c5fdb99f0581e40957cb0c)

Ok merging now to make the things that depend on this easier.'}]

commit_message:
Remove deprecated novaclient.v2.contrib modules

All modules of novaclient.v2.contrib have been removed.
The 'only_contrib' parameter for the
'novaclient.client.discover_extensions' method is no longer valid.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 09:11:44.000000000', 'message': "Increase tempest-full jobs timeout to 3h

Jobs tempest-full and tempest-full-py3 are included in
neutron-lib's check and gate queues because they are in
lib-forward-testing and lib-forward-testing-python3 templates.
But in those templates those jobs have 2h timeout which is sometimes
not enough to complete job.

In Neutron repo we increased this timeout to 3h already some time ago
and that helped a lot with such timeouts so lets increase it also
in neuton-lib repo to avoid some rechecks.

Change-Id: Ic3ce87a8c3417957afe7fc1e1ebd74dcff639737
"}]
commit_message:
Increase tempest-full jobs timeout to 3h

Jobs tempest-full and tempest-full-py3 are included in
neutron-lib's check and gate queues because they are in
lib-forward-testing and lib-forward-testing-python3 templates.
But in those templates those jobs have 2h timeout which is sometimes
not enough to complete job.

In Neutron repo we increased this timeout to 3h already some time ago
and that helped a lot with such timeouts so lets increase it also
in neuton-lib repo to avoid some rechecks.

Change-Id: Ic3ce87a8c3417957afe7fc1e1ebd74dcff639737

commit_message:
Remove args/kwargs from discover_extensions()

The 'only_contrib' kwarg in the discover_extensions()
method was deprecated in Pike:

  Ie2e3fdc4e044f6eb304724d16a7d0f1f7ba705fd

So we should be able to remove that now, along with the
args/kwargs in the method signature.

It's not clear to me if this is used externally so I
have not provided a release note.

Change-Id: I891761e6e152eabb4f9ea0526d51e93f15904c1b

commit_message:
Remove -u root as mysql is executed with root user

As openstack installation guides suggest to run mysql with root shell
user, mysql will not ask for password, so in
controller-install-*.rst "-u root -p" is useless.

Change-Id: I343021473227899ed9460038d3b082da6c90556c
Related-Bug: #1785025

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-19 14:37:36.000000000', 'message': 'Support custom local projects and legacy projects

Add --legacy and --projects options to the owners CLI, which make it
possible to specify local alternatives for the legacy.yaml and
projects.yaml files. This enables easily running the tool for
unofficial/non-OpenStack elections which use the same Gerrit and
similar rules for determining their electorates other than the
actual repository lists.

Change-Id: I45d6c4d4fd454ae426883006db1e58dbd373bbdf
'}]
commit_message:
Support custom local projects and legacy projects

Add --legacy and --projects options to the owners CLI, which make it
possible to specify local alternatives for the legacy.yaml and
projects.yaml files. This enables easily running the tool for
unofficial/non-OpenStack elections which use the same Gerrit and
similar rules for determining their electorates other than the
actual repository lists.

Change-Id: I45d6c4d4fd454ae426883006db1e58dbd373bbdf

[{'created': '2019-01-19 14:37:36.000000000', 'message': "Don't encode contributor names in invites

Now that we don't support Python 2.7 with this tooling, we can drop
the explicit encoding in invitee names. Without this change, they're
recorded as explicit byte sequences instead of normal UTF-8 strings.

Change-Id: I9e0220dbdb241ab6bd464fd5cdfcaf5f3e2a6399
"}]
commit_message:
Don't encode contributor names in invites

Now that we don't support Python 2.7 with this tooling, we can drop
the explicit encoding in invitee names. Without this change, they're
recorded as explicit byte sequences instead of normal UTF-8 strings.

Change-Id: I9e0220dbdb241ab6bd464fd5cdfcaf5f3e2a6399

Some required check (e.g. no id specified) is missing in some newer
cases of policy creation. This patch fixes the oversight.

subject: Correct notification driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 22:29:33.000000000', 'message': 'Correct notification driver

The notification driver setup was resulting in the driver and connection string
on the same line. This is caused by the case statement and how jinja formats
the template when a case statement is present. This change modifies how the
driver string is created using a ternary, which will eliminate the case
statement and render the value of the diver correctly.

Change-Id: I32be3b07344d1f4846704b120d1c075e42472176
'}]
commit_message:
Correct notification driver

The notification driver setup was resulting in the driver and connection string
on the same line. This is caused by the case statement and how jinja formats
the template when a case statement is present. This change modifies how the
driver string is created using a ternary, which will eliminate the case
statement and render the value of the diver correctly.

Change-Id: I32be3b07344d1f4846704b120d1c075e42472176

Always use luminous for manila

Bring CentOS in line with ubuntu and use luminous rather than
jewel for all manila builds.

commit_message:
Set ovsdb probe interval to 1 minute on the client side

When a failover of ovsdb-server occurs, neither neutron-server nor
ovn-metadata-agent detects the disconnection. Even though this should
be fixed in OVS Python IDL, this patch is adding a default probe
interval from the client side to 60 seconds. This way, when the
connection to the VIP is lost, clients will reconnect and the service
will be back up again.

Change-Id: Idec3344136a85d73969ed8e11d358b66c14d9a4d
Closes-Bug: #1772656
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90c2a1c26f5ec276a1154648538efd373e458afa)

commit_message:
Change agents to use get_devices_with_ip()

Instead of instantiating an IPDevice object just to get
the list of IPs, call get_devices_with_ip() instead since
that's what it's doing anyways.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I5055d24a40d45f3f3b13b05249d353ea67acf4d5
